detaileddescription.para:
Calculates the sum of the absolute values of each component of the vector. ret := |x_1| + ... + |x_n|
\Np\vector $v
Vector X buffer
float

Add vectors Y := alpha * X + Y
float $alpha
Coefficient of scalar multiple of X vector
\Np\vector $vect_X
Vector X buffer
\Np\vector $vect_Y
Vector Y buffer
void

Copy the vector from X to Y. Y := X
\Np\vector $vect_X
Vector X buffer
\Np\vector $vect_Y
Vector Y buffer
int $invX
int $invY
void

Give the point P (a, b). Rotate this point to givens and calculate the parameters a, b, c, and s to make the y coordinate zero. Conditions description: c * a + s * b = r -s * a + c * b = 0 r = ||(a,b)|| c^2 + s^2 = 1 z=s if |a| > |b| z=1/c if |a| <= |b| and c != 0 and r != 0 Find r, z, c, s that satisfies the above description. However, when r = 0, z = 0, c = 1, and s = 0 are returned. Also, if c = 0, | a | <= | b | and c! = 0 and r! = 0, z = 1 is returned.
float $a
X-coordinate of P: The calculated r value is stored and returned
float $b
Y-coordinate of P: The calculated z value is stored and returned
float $c
Stores the calculated value of c
float $s
Stores the calculated value of s
void

Compute the product of a general matrix and a vector stored in band format. y := alpha * Ax + beta * y
int $KL
Number of elements in the lower left part
int $KU
Number of elements in the upper right part
double $alpha
Coefficient of scalar multiple of vector
double $beta
Coefficient of scalar multiple of mvr
\Np\matrix $matrix
\Np\vector $vector
\Np\vector $mvr

Product of general matrix and general matrix C := alpha * AB + beta * C Float
\Np\matrix $m1
\Np\matrix $m2
\Np\matrix $mr

Compute the product of a column vector and a row vector. (Real number) A := alpha * x y^t + A
\Np\vector $v1
\Np\vector $v2
\Np\matrix $m
void
Calculates the index of the element with the largest absolute value in the vector. Note that this subscript starts from 1. If 0 is returned, n is invalid. ret := arg max |X(i)|

simplesect.para: int index of the element(Note that start from 0 according to cblas)

detaileddescription.para: Calculates the index of the element with the smallest absolute value in the vector. Note that this subscript starts from 1. If 0 is returned, n is invalid. ret := arg min |X(i)|

Compute the Euclidean norm of a vector. ret := ||X||
\Np\vector $v
float

Rotate about a given point. X(i) := c * X(i) + s * Y(i) Y(i) :=-s * X(i) + c * Y(i)
\Np\vector $v1
Vector X buffer
\Np\vector $v2
Vector Y buffer
float $c
value of cos A(Value obtained with rotg function.)
float $s
value of sin A(Value obtained with rotg function.)

parameterdescription.para: Coefficient of scalar multiple of V vector

detaileddescription.para:
Exchange the contents of the vector. X := Y Y := X
\Np\vector $v1
\Np\vector $v2
int $inv1
int $inv2
Product of symmetric matrix and general matrix C := alpha * AB + beta * C or C := alpha * BA + beta * C
Update rank 2k of symmetric matrix C := alpha * A B^T + alpha B A^T + beta * C or C := alpha * B^T A + alpha A^T B + beta * C
Update rank n of symmetric matrix C := alpha * A A^T + beta * C or C := alpha * A^T A + beta * C
